name: Python
summary: A versatile, high-level programming language for data science, ML, and general-purpose development.

name: Scala
summary: A functional and object-oriented language for JVM, excellent for big data and concurrent systems.

name: SQL
summary: Standard language for relational database management and data querying.

name: Nix
summary: A purely functional package manager and system configuration language.

name: Bash
summary: Unix shell and command language for system administration and automation.

name: Rust
summary: A systems programming language focused on safety, speed, and concurrency.

name: Julia
summary: A high-performance programming language for numerical computing, combining speed and expressiveness.

name: Haskell
summary: A purely functional programming language with strong static typing and lazy evaluation.

name: Go
summary: A statically typed, compiled language designed for simplicity and efficiency.

name: C
summary: A low-level, procedural programming language for system programming.

name: C++
summary: An extension of C with object-oriented features for systems and application development.

name: TypeScript
summary: A typed superset of JavaScript that compiles to plain JavaScript.

name: Node.js
summary: A JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 engine for server-side development.

name: TensorFlow
summary: An open-source machine learning framework for deep learning and neural networks.

name: PyTorch
summary: A dynamic deep learning framework with strong GPU acceleration and Python integration.

name: Power BI
summary: Microsoft's business intelligence platform for data visualization and analytics.

name: XGBoost
summary: An optimized gradient boosting framework for machine learning competitions and production.

name: Hugging Face
summary: A platform and library ecosystem for natural language processing and transformers.

name: Scikit-learn
summary: A comprehensive machine learning library for Python with simple and efficient tools.

name: Pandas
summary: A powerful data manipulation and analysis library for Python.

name: Polars
summary: A fast DataFrame library for Rust and Python with lazy evaluation.

name: NumPy
summary: The fundamental package for scientific computing with Python.

name: PyArrow
summary: Python bindings for Apache Arrow columnar in-memory analytics.

name: Apache Spark
summary: A unified engine for large-scale data processing with built-in modules for streaming, SQL, ML and graph processing.

name: Kafka
summary: A distributed event streaming platform for high-throughput data pipelines and streaming analytics.

name: Flink
summary: A framework for stateful computations over data streams with low latency and high throughput.

name: Terraform
summary: Infrastructure as code software tool for building, changing and versioning infrastructure safely and efficiently.

name: AWS SageMaker
summary: Fully managed service for building, training, and deploying machine learning models at scale.

name: AWS Bedrock
summary: Serverless platform for building and deploying generative AI applications using foundation models.

name: AWS Comprehend
summary: NLP service for entity extraction, sentiment analysis, topic modeling, and language detection.

name: AWS Forecast
summary: Fully managed service for time-series forecasting using machine learning, no ML experience required.

name: AWS Glue
summary: Serverless data integration service for ETL, cataloging, and preparing data for analytics and ML.

name: AWS Lambda
summary: Serverless compute service that runs your code in response to events and automatically manages the underlying infrastructure.

name: AWS S3
summary: Scalable object storage service used for storing and retrieving any amount of data from anywhere.

name: AWS CloudWatch
summary: Monitoring and observability service for logs, metrics, and application performance on AWS.

name: Azure
summary: Microsoft's cloud computing service for building, testing, deploying, and managing applications.

name: GCP
summary: Google Cloud Platform offering computing, data storage, data analytics and machine learning services.

name: Docker
summary: A platform for developing, shipping, and running applications using containerization technology.

name: Kubernetes
summary: An open-source container orchestration platform for automating deployment, scaling, and management.

name: MLflow
summary: An open source platform for managing the end-to-end machine learning lifecycle.

name: Kubeflow
summary: A machine learning toolkit for Kubernetes to deploy ML workflows on Kubernetes clusters.

name: NixOS
summary: A Linux distribution built on the Nix package manager with declarative configuration management.

name: Linux
summary: A family of open-source Unix-like operating systems based on the Linux kernel.

name: PostgreSQL
summary: A powerful, open source object-relational database system with advanced features.

name: Qdrant
summary: A vector similarity search engine optimized for extended filtering support.

name: React
summary: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces with component-based architecture.

name: FastAPI
summary: A modern, fast web framework for building APIs with Python based on standard Python type hints.

name: Streamlit
summary: An open-source framework for creating data science and machine learning web applications.

name: JAX
summary: A Python library for accelerated scientific computing and machine learning research.

name: Ray
summary: A unified framework for scaling AI and Python applications from laptops to clusters.

name: LangChain
summary: A framework for developing applications powered by language models with chaining capabilities.

name: LlamaIndex
summary: A data framework for connecting custom data sources to large language models.

name: GitHub Actions
summary: GitHub's CI/CD platform for automating workflows directly in your repository.

name: Argo CD
summary: A declarative, GitOps continuous delivery tool for Kubernetes applications.

name: Airflow
summary: A platform to programmatically author, schedule and monitor workflows as DAGs.

name: Databricks
summary: A unified analytics platform for data science, data engineering and machine learning.

name: SOPS
summary: A simple and flexible tool for managing secrets in code repositories using encryption.

name: pnpm
summary: A fast, disk space efficient package manager for JavaScript with strict dependency resolution.

name: Turborepo
summary: A high-performance build system for JavaScript and TypeScript codebases with intelligent caching.

name: Karpenter
summary: A high-performance Kubernetes node autoscaler for efficiently scaling compute resources on AWS EKS.

name: Istio
summary: An open-source service mesh that layers transparently onto existing distributed applications.

name: Oracle DB
summary: A multi-model database management system known for its robust enterprise features and scalability.

name: Apache Hadoop
summary: An open-source framework for distributed storage and processing of large datasets across clusters.

name: Grafana
summary: An open-source platform for monitoring and observability, allowing visualization of metrics and logs.

name: SAP
summary: Enterprise resource planning (ERP) software used for managing business operations and customer relations.

name: StatsModels
summary: A Python module providing classes and functions for the estimation of many different statistical models.

name: Home Manager
summary: A declarative configuration manager for user-specific dotfiles and packages on NixOS and other Linux systems.

name: NixOS-anywhere
summary: A tool for declaratively installing and deploying NixOS systems over SSH.

name: systemd
summary: A suite of fundamental building blocks for a Linux operating system, including an init system and service manager.

name: Just
summary: A command runner for easily building and running project-specific recipes, similar to Makefiles.

name: Age
summary: A simple, modern, and secure file encryption tool with a minimalist interface.

name: Vercel
summary: A platform for frontend developers to deploy and host websites and web services, offering serverless functions and global CDN.

name: SCSS
summary: A preprocessor scripting language that is interpreted or compiled into Cascading Style Sheets (CSS).
